N80050
UNITED
UNITED
presenting the BEST OF THE JETS the DC-8 JET MAINLINER by DOUGLAS

yes, the best of the jets is here... UNITED AIR LINES
DC 8 JET MAINLINER
THE FIRST JETLINER DESIGNED SPECIFICALLY FOR PASSENGER SERVICE
The combined experience of Douglas Aircraft Company.
Pratt and Whitney and United Air Lines has been planned
into the DC-8 Jet Mainliner, truly the newest, finest—
the best of the jets. The DC-8, designed exclusively for
passenger service is a worthy successor to the long
line of proven "DC" planes which carry four
out of five of the world's air travelers.
FIRST CLASS
ENTRANCE
-FIRST CLASS
LOUNGE
• BUFFET
- FORWARD REST
ROOMS
- FIRST CLASS
CABIN
THE RED CARPET ROOM
Most luxurious lounge of any jetliner
is located far ahead of the swept-
back wing and extends across the
full width of the airplane.
This "room with a view" styled
by Raymond Loewy, invites
fun and relaxation.
UNITED
- COACH CABIN
ONE OF THE NATION'S
FINEST DINING PLACES
Dinner time on first-class
Red Carpet flights presents
a culinary masterpiece.
Menus rivaling those of
the nation's finest dining
places are set off by rich
damask cloths, sparkling
silver and fine china.
•COACH LOUNGE
-BUFFET
COACH ENTRANCE
AFT REST ROOMS
QUALITY COACH SERVICE
The coach cabin of United's
DC-8 Jet Mainliner con-
tinues the rich decor of
custom design.
Handsomely tailored seats
offer generous leg room and
built-in seat conveniences,
including individual fold-
down tables for your
Custom Coach meal service.
UNITED
JET MAINLINER BY DOUGLAS

BUT IT TAKES MORE THAN A JET AIRLINER TO MAKE A JET AIR LINE
UNITED
DC-8 SPECIFICATIONS
Wing Span
142 feet 5 inches
Overall length
150 feet 6 inches
Overall height
42 feet 4 inches
Wing sweepback 30 Degrees
Total Cargo Volume,
2 lower compartments 1162 cubic feet
Power Plants
(Pratt & Whitney J 57)
4 Turbojet Engines
(Pratt & Whitney J 75)
Gross Weight, pounds
265,000 to 300,000
Landing Weight, pounds
190,000
Fuel Capacity, Pounds
117,900
Fuel Capacity, Gallons
17,600
Cruise True Air Speed,
miles per hour
516 to 591
NEW CONCEPT FOR CARGO
The DC-8 carries up to 11 pre-
loaded containers with a total
cargo capacity of 19,465 pounds.
Each container can be loaded and
handled individually providing the
fastest, most modern baggage sys-
tem available.
PLANNING FOR THE JET AGE
United Air Lines began prepara-
tion for the jet age long before re-
ceiving the first DC-8 Jet Main-
liner. Electronic devices like this
Link flight simulator have given
hours of valuable experience to
United personnel in addition to
their normal equipment indoctri-
nation.
2001.039. 213a

UNITED
NEW HIGH-SPEED RESERVATIONS SERVICE
FOR JET AGE TRAVELERS
INSTAMATIC was developed especially for United
Air Lines by The Teleregister Corporation. It will
be the world's largest integrated data processing
system developed for private industry.
The Central Processor site will be located at
United's Operating Base in Denver and will con-
sist of three transistorized Telefile Processors.
INSTAMATIC'S 12,000 miles of leased lines will
From this electronic console United agents will be able to confirm your
reservations in a few seconds from any major city on the Main Line Airway.
speed inquiries from 1,000 agent sets at 150 loca-
tions in 68
cities nationwide into the Central
Processor at the amazing speed of 15 inquiries
per second, or the equivalent of 54,000 messages
per hour. The average response time to an inquiry
will be 1½ seconds.
INSTAMATIC will operate 24 hours a day and
will be another
progressive step to bring you
"Extra Care" on the ground and aloft.
UNITED
AIR LINES
